thread.title: Seeing double on the PBA Tour
thread.title_full: Seeing double on the PBA Tour

author: Red Burnham For the Journal Inquirer
title: Seeing double on the PBA Tour
text:
Seeing double on the PBA Tour By Red Burnham For the Journal Inquirer Journal   
The bowling season is now in high gear not only on the league side of things, but also on the professional schedule. And if you like to watch the best in the world in action, you’ll want to have the PBA’s Xtra Frame online live streaming channel because it’s there for you 24/7. 
Monday marks the start of the Mark Roth/Marshall Holman Doubles Championship at the new South Point Bowling Plaza in Las Vegas, where Wes Malott and Norm Duke will be defending the title they won last season in Indianapolis. But it won’t be easy pickings against teams like Jason Belmonte and Bill O’Neill or Parker Bohn and Ryan Ciminelli, and the list goes on. 
It all opens with eight qualifying games Monday followed by two six-game match-play rounds on Tuesday, when the top five teams will head to the five-game stepladder finals Thursday at 8:30 p.m. kAm%9:D :D ;FDE E96 368:??:?8 @7 H92E :D D92A:?8 FA 2D 2 8C62E 3@H=:?8 D62D@? 7@C E96 !qp H:E9 A=6?EJ @7 !qp =628F6 24E:@?
